meaning_mnemonic: Your <radical>foot</radical> heard an <radical>omen</radical> and now it's making you <kanji>hop</kanji> over things.
The <radical>sun</radical> <radical>call</radical>s out to the earth by <kanji>shining</kanji> down on it.

A <radical>tsunami</radical> pushes all the <radical>fish</radical> closer to land, making for some easy <kanji>fishing</kanji>. The tsunami starts out in the middle of the ocean and pushes all the fish towards the coast where everyone does their fishing. With all the fish pushed closer to land and closer together, it’s very easy for people to go fishing in one spot and catch a lot of fish.

The <radical>leader</radical> presents you with a <radical>prize</radical> as <kanji>reparation</kanji> for his past deeds. This leader wronged you in the past and wishes to make amends. Therefore the leader presents you with a reparation in the form of a glittering prize.
Destroy a <radical>lantern</radical> with your <radical>knife</radical> and you'll be <kanji>punish</kanji>ed.

A <radical>greenhouse</radical> is the newest <radical>power</radical> of the city you decided to <kanji>recruit</kanji>. You’re trying to recruit all the buildings in town and the greenhouse was the next on your list. It adds just a little bit of power to the town, but it's important nonetheless.

<radical>Happiness</radical> is a <radical>circle</radical> that's <kanji>tenacious</kanji>. In other words, we're all in this circle/cycle where we do whatever we can to grab onto happiness and hold it as tightly as we can.

Under the <radical>rice paddy</radical>, an <radical>explosion</radical> shakes the <radical>dirt</radical>, exposing a hidden <kanji>base</kanji>. A <kanji>baseball base</kanji>! I guess this rice paddy was built on top of an old baseball field…
Below this <radical>mountain</radical>, a <radical>moon</radical> and another <radical>moon</radical> crash into each other and the entire thing <kanji>crumble</kanji>s to pieces.

A <radical>skewer</radical> to the <radical>heart</radical> has <kanji>afflicted</kanji> your health. You’ve been afflicted with a disease from the skewer to your heart. Your affliction is death. You’re dying.

This <radical>door</radical> is <radical>big</radical> and you need to <kanji>return</kanji> it to its rightful owner. This door is too big and important looking to not belong to someone. You need to find its owner and return it to them.
You take your <radical>fingers</radical> and slam a <radical>lid</radical> on the <radical>table</radical>. You make this big noise to <kanji>confront</kanji> the person in front of you.

Your <radical>fingers</radical> join the rest of your <radical>clan</radical>, pressed into the <radical>ground</radical> to declare that you will <kanji>resist</kanji> your lords. Your clan is made of a bunch of peasants, but you aren't going to work the land for other people anymore. You're going to resist. Your fingers work for no one but yourselves from now on!

When a <radical>prison</radical> holds the <radical>sun</radical> inside it, everything will always be <kanji>in season</kanji>. Obviously if the sun is in prison, the seasons can't change. Want to eat perfect apples all year round? Just put the sun in prison when they're ripe — usually a short window of <kanji>ten days</kanji>.
<radical>Tsunami</radical>s hit these lands <radical>again</radical> and again, molding it into some kind of <radical>bow</radical> shape. Or in other words, creating a <kanji>gulf</kanji>.

If you combine <radical>fire</radical> with <radical>violence</radical>, it will <kanji>explode</kanji>! A fire, once full of violence, will surely explode. The fire can’t handle all that violence so the fire just rumbles and shakes and then finally explodes. BOOM!

What's like a <radical>bow</radical>, but even more <radical>simple</radical>? A <kanji>bullet</kanji>. With a bow, you have to load an arrow and pull back the string and aim, yuck. Bullets can be shot with just a simple squeeze of a trigger.

When your <radical>ear</radical> is <radical>cross</radical>ed with sound, it catches it like a <radical>net</radical>, and sends it to your <radical>heart</radical> for processing. Because you're using your heart to process this sound, it means you're giving it a proper <kanji>listen</kanji>.
When you're stepping around with your <radical>foot</radical> <radical>again</radical> and again, you'll leave behind <kanji>traces</kanji> all over the place.

On the <radical>scooter</radical> is an <radical>insect</radical> and a <radical>bear</radical>. The bear immediately stomps the insect, squishing it flat. "My god, the insect is smashed. Someone call <kanji>dispatch</kanji>!"

At this <radical>gate</radical> you're trying to get some <radical>beans</radical> through, but your <radical>measurements</radical> were off, leading to a big <kanji>fight</kanji>. The bean authorities at the gate always want to fight about bean sizes, and now you have to fight to get those beans through.

This <radical>building</radical> is full of <radical>car</radical>s because it's an <kanji>army camp</kanji>. The cars (and tanks and planes) need to be ready to go at any moment just like the soldiers.

<radical>Grain</radical> left in the <radical>sun</radical> blossom and give off a wonderful <kanji>fragrance</kanji>. They smell fresh and delicious. There's nothing better than the fragrance of fresh, sun-kissed grain.
The <radical>omen</radical> radical and the <kanji>omen</kanji> kanji are the same!

You give your <radical>servant</radical> a <radical>gun</radical> along with some other <radical>products</radical> to <kanji>look to</kanji>. You can’t look to them yourself since you are very busy. You allow your servant to look to your gun and the other products.
A <radical>triceratops</radical> with a <radical>moon</radical> <radical>knife</radical> can <kanji>whittle down</kanji> anything.

The weight of <radical>life</radical> on your <radical>sword</radical> is <radical>big</radical> when you <kanji>pledge</kanji> to protect your city. That's the big, big weight of every single person's life in that city pressing down on you every time you take out that sword.

You carry a <radical>cross</radical> across a <radical>rice paddy</radical> with a <radical>heart</radical> on it to return a <kanji>favor</kanji> for your friend. The heart needs to be purified so that’s why you have it on the cross and your friend lives on a rice paddy farm so that’s why you’re running through that. The favor you are paying your friend back with is getting him this heart. He needs a new one and you’re providing it.

Take your <radical>fingers</radical> and <radical>wrap</radical> them around another person. This is called a <kanji>hug</kanji>. Just make sure you include all the stuff attached to your fingers, like your hands and arms too, otherwise it's more of a squeeze, and we don't want to do that to people.
Use your <radical>fingers</radical> when the <radical>sun</radical> shines into your <radical>prison</radical> cell and hold your <radical>spoon</radical> up in full <kanji>display</kanji>.
You see an <radical>animal</radical> wearing a <radical>top hat</radical> and decide to <kanji>aim</kanji> at it. The top hat is a perfect, giant target you use to take down this animal.

You brought <radical>flowers</radical> to leave at the place where a <radical>yakuza</radical> took a <radical>spoon</radical> and killed <radical>twenty</radical> people, since there's now a <kanji>burial</kanji> happening there. You didn't know these people, but you still want to leave flowers at their burial.

Put <radical>thread</radical> in the <radical>mouth</radical> of a worm while the <radical>moon</radical> is out and it will poop out some <kanji>silk</kanji>. That's why they call them silkworms, didn't you know? But it has to be while the moon is out, otherwise normal thread will come right back out the other end of the worm. The moon is what makes the magic happen.
The <radical>skewer</radical> radical and the <kanji>skewer</kanji> kanji are exactly the same!

You're holding a <radical>flag</radical> on a <radical>stick</radical> above your <radical>eye</radical>s to imitate <kanji>eyebrows</kanji>. You can't grow any of your own, but you really love eyebrows, so this was the best you could do.
